sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The doctrine of passive obedience and jure divino disproved and obedience to the present government, proved from Scripture, law, and reason. Written for the satisfaction of all of those who are dissatisfied at the present government: by a lay-man of the Church of England. Harrison, T. (Thomas), fl. 1683-1711.
8 p.
London, printed by Randal Taylor, near Stationers-Hall and reprinted at Edinburgh, [[Edinburgh] : anno Dom. 1689]
Caption title. Imprint from colophon. A lay-man of the Church of England = Thomas Harrison. Cf. Wing. Reproduction of the original in the Aberdeen University Library.
=======
